@anerlikar79 @socialepfo Dear Sir/Madam,

text:
India's Hon. Home Minister Shri Amit Shah inaugurated a statue of Shrimant Bajirao Peshwa-I at Khadakwasla, Pune, Maharashtra, India.

After the death of his father, Peshwa Balaji Vishwanath, Chhatrapati Shahu Maharaj-I declared Shrimant Bajirao as his next Peshwa, he was just 19 https://t.co/cS8z7j3cCz

text: @Hotillax @TAKEOVERWW Yes, dying without much pain is possible. Studies (e.g., WHO pain ladder) show effective management in 80-90% of terminal cases via palliative care. Natural sudden deaths like cardiac arrest are often painless. Literature reviews (PMC) find 81% of definitions of "good death"

text:
Tanishk Malhotra, a 20-year-old from Pune, drowned while swimming at Kashid Beach on July 1. He was pulled in by strong undercurrents.

A 43-hour search involving thermal drones and helicopters led to the recovery of his body. His disappearance had sparked a large-scale rescue https://t.co/nMk79eIFaj
